bcbioRNASeq 0.3.16

Counts

Source: R/counts-methods.R
counts.Rd

Count matrix.

# S4 method for bcbioRNASeq
counts(object, normalized = FALSE)

Arguments

object

Object.
normalized

character(1) or logical(1). Which normalization method to apply:

  • FALSE: Raw counts. When using a tximport-compatible caller, these are length scaled by default (see countsFromAbundance argument). When using a featureCounts-compatible caller, these are integer.

tximport caller-specific normalizations:

  • "tpm": Transcripts per million.

Additional gene-level-specific normalizations:

  • TRUE: Size factor-adjusted counts.
    See DESeq2::sizeFactors for more information.

  • "vst": Variance-stabilizing transformation.
    Requires vst = TRUE to be set during bcbioRNASeq call.
    See DESeq2::varianceStabilizingTransformation for more information.

  • "rlog": Regularized log transformation (log2).
    Requires rlog = TRUE to be set during bcbioRNASeq call.
    See DESeq2::rlog for more information.

  • "tmm": Trimmed mean of M-values.
    See edgeR::calcNormFactors for more information.

  • "rle": Relative log expression transformation.

  • "fpkm": Fragments per kilobase per million mapped fragments.
    Requires annotations in rowRanges with defined width; otherwise, will be skipped during the bcbioRNASeq load call.
    See BiocGenerics::width and DESeq2::fpkm for more information.

Value

matrix.

Details

By default, return the raw counts. Normalized counts in a variety of formats can be accessed using the normalized argument.

References

  • TMM: Robinson and Oshlack (2010).

  • RLE: Anders and Huber (2010).

See also

  • tximport::tximport().

  • DESeq2::counts().

  • DESeq2::sizeFactors().

  • DESeq2::varianceStabilizingTransformation().

  • DESeq2::rlog().

  • DESeq2::fpkm().

  • edgeR::calcNormFactors().

  • tmm().

  • relativeLogExpression().

Examples

data(bcb)
summary(counts(bcb))
#>   control_rep1       control_rep2       control_rep3       fa_day7_rep1     
#>  Min.   :       0   Min.   :       0   Min.   :       0   Min.   :       1  
#>  1st Qu.:     419   1st Qu.:     904   1st Qu.:     317   1st Qu.:     579  
#>  Median :    1389   Median :    3397   Median :    1315   Median :    1725  
#>  Mean   :   43568   Mean   :   86384   Mean   :   41167   Mean   :   39351  
#>  3rd Qu.:    4692   3rd Qu.:   11303   3rd Qu.:    4125   3rd Qu.:    5373  
#>  Max.   :11767239   Max.   :22627793   Max.   :11608372   Max.   :10623916  
#>   fa_day7_rep2      fa_day7_rep3     
#>  Min.   :      0   Min.   :       0  
#>  1st Qu.:    501   1st Qu.:     769  
#>  Median :   1557   Median :    1904  
#>  Mean   :  34610   Mean   :   42438  
#>  3rd Qu.:   4840   3rd Qu.:    5304  
#>  Max.   :9676254   Max.   :12145225
